Karenâ€™s place is a gem! Her home is pristine. It was squeaky clean throughout.
Karen was easy to reach during our stay to answer any questions we had. She always promptly responded.
Her organization made our stay stress free! She provided written instructions as to what her expectations were for us, where to find things, appliance and device manuals. Everything was tastefully and clearly labeled. Wi-Fi was excellent.
Karen generously provided snacks and use of food staples.
The view from the deck is beautiful, peaceful, a lovely space to relax.
Our only suggestion is to have a hand rail by the concrete steps at the side entrance.
We highly recommend Karenâ€™s place to all. We would definitely enjoy staying there again!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: This was the perfect house for our family weekend! The set-up of the house was just right, with the playspace (and toys!) downstairs and a vast outdoor area, which was a perfect place to let the kids run, even on rainy days (great washer-dryer ...). Having a pantry well-stocked with essentials, as well as two complete kitchens filled with small appliances, dinnerware and utensils, made managing meals for our crowd so much easier than we have experienced at other short-term rentals. These hosts really anticipated every possible need, and provided extras of EVERYTHING, as well as great recommendations for activities and restaurants in the area. The location is so private (we had deer visit on several mornings!), yet five minutes away from a supermarket, a playground, drugstore and great coffee options! We were thrilled that we could bring our dog as well. An overall excellent experience that we would highly recommend to any group, especially families with young children. Thanks!

We drove to Vermont for the fall foliage. When we arrived at this cabin we were stunned by the breathtaking view! We spent a morning doing nothing but simply sitting in front of the cabin, immersing ourselves in the nature. In the evening we lit the campfire and forgot all the worries. Incredible experience! Would like to come again the next foliage season!
The hosts are very friendly and always ready to help (everything went very smoothly so actually we don't need to contact them). Winnie is adorable and we'll definitely miss her!
This location is private yet not far away from downtown.

Their dog Winnie is adorable and Travis is a great host - he was there if needed, friendly but didn't intrude. He welcomed us to use the outdoor fire pit and there is an outdoor shower and tubs! We really enjoyed some serious down time in a peaceful, bucolic, rural setting. Great place if you like to kick back or paint landscape or other creative pursuits. Dining at Positive Pie in town is awesome as is the Plainfield Food Coop for food. It's near Barre and Montpelier, which is slowly digging out - Sarduccis, Skinny Pancake and a coffee shop are open now.

review_text:
My wife and I together with our dog had an incredible stay in the hills of Central Vermont at Travisâ€™ beautiful cabin.
The property was quiet, serene, and had an incredible view overlooking the surrounding green hills & mountains.
The porch/deck was spotless and had great seating for chilling with a glass of wine or beer in the evenings, and a cup of joe with a view in the mornings.
Our dog loved the property, and it gave him space to stretch his legs through the manicured lawn and apple trees.
The cabin itself was perfect for a cozy stay for two. It had everything we needed and was smartly decorated, along with a very comfortable bed.
Travis was very helpful with some great local recommendations, including food (Positive Pie down the hill in Plainfield had fantastic take out, try the fried brussel sprouts) and local hiking opportunities (Spruce Mountain).
We definitely hope to return to Travisâ€™ cabin in the future. Thanks for the great hospitality and good times!

We grabbed dinner at the Plainfield location of Positive Pie, very tasty and only a 5-minute drive from the cabin. Overall, we would definitely recommend Travis' cabin for any stays in Central/Northern VT. We will be back!

review_text:
Staying here was some of the best money I've ever spent.
Short story long, my boyfriend took me camping for the first time, and I decided it wasn't for me lol. I was going to book a random hotel room, but he found this place, and we were able to book about 9 hours before we showed up.
Travis was an excellent host. He let us know he was out of town, but his friend would turn over the cabin, and he hoped it was sufficient and to let him know if we needed anything.
Let me just say that the pictures of the view do not do it justice. Spectacular and breathtaking don't begin to cover it. We took advantage of the outdoor tubs as the sun was going down.. wow! I would've spent the money for that experience alone. It really was magical.
Inside the cabin was very clean and comfortable. Since I didn't get much sleep the night before, I was so thankful to have a clean, comfy bed to sleep in.
Overall, if I could give more stars, I would. I can't wait to plan another stay here soon!
Thank you Travis!

review_text:
Fun, unusual, and pristine completely renovated trailer with privacy and a location close to both Barre and Montpellier (10 min either way). Private parking and a separate well-lighted pathway led to our trailer home. Keypad entry, very convenient.
Beautiful wood finishes throughout, and equipped with a full sized refrigerator and stove as well as a stall shower, couch, drop-down table, lots of cabinet space, and two sleeping lofts. One loft accessed through a staircase built into the side of the trailer with a comfortable queen bed and curtained windows looking across to the mountains over the fields. We didnâ€™t use the second loft area. Nice linens and pillows. Note itâ€™s a loft, the ceiling is close (although arched). Not a problem for us.
Kitchen well stocked with Keurig, microwave, toaster, service for two, towels, drying rack, and cleaning supplies.
Cupboards stocked with games, a few books, additional storage.
Charming, eclectic and a real sense of being somewhere else!!

We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

She had keys, hand sanitizer and Covid form ready on little table inside garage when we arrived. Both checkin and check-out were easy, quick and very efficient. The space is brand new and beautifully renovated. Loved that the 2 rooms were on opposite sides of the living room so we had some privacy. Plenty of storage space for clothes. Having kids, I really appreciated that all electrical outlets were protected by safety plugs and she had kid cutlery and plates in kitchen. Great to have washer/dryer as well. Kitchen had everything we needed, including complimentary coffee and water bottles. Appreciated the recommendations for food shopping and dining out. Super comfy rocking chair (a big hit with my kids) and beds. Location was quiet neighborhood with playground 7min walk or 2min drive. Quick 5min drive to downtown Barre. Beth was also quick at getting back to me and extremely accommodating with a few of my date changes. Would definitely stay here again if we come back to the area!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

February 2024
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The apartment worked out perfectly for us. Very clean and nice inside. Relatively easy drive up to Stowe for skiing (~35 to 45 min) but also have local amenities such as a Hannaford grocery store about 5 minutes away and a large Walmart not too far either (15 mins).
Location:
The house is a multi-family with more than one apartment, and it's across the street from some industrial buildings, but it was quiet and worked out really well. Seems really well isolated. Plus, it was close to everything we needed in town.
Accommodations:
The apartment was clean and comfortable and looked to have been recently redone. Bedrooms were clean and worked out well. Washer and dryer were new and useful. There is only one bathroom on the main floor while all the bedrooms are on the top floor. Not a problem though.
Check-in and checkout:
Checked in via a code on the door. Worked well. Put in the same code to lock the door when you leave.
Overall, would be happy to stay there again.

review_text: Very clean and well appointed unit! This unit is one of three in the building. It's conveniently located with easy access to restaurants and stores in Barre. The house was cleaned just before we arrived and the cleaner communicated to the host that the town water was dirty. We were informed and able to pick up some jugs of water for drinking & coffee before we arrived. The unit was very clean and had everything we needed for our three night stay. We enjoyed coffee and breakfast in the morning before heading out for the day. The house is located in a mixed use neighborhood. There are plenty of houses around but also some industrial-use sites as well. We felt comfortable and safe inside the unit, but the location is for convenience and not for enjoying the view. It met our needs as we were on the go most of each day. The value was great for us. We had much more space than a hotel room would provide. I would stay here again, or look for other listings from this host.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our 3 day stay in Vermont was made so much nicer by this wonderful accommodation. Set on the top of a hill in peaceful, rural Plainfield, we were able to see beautiful mountain peaks with stunning sunrises and sunsets. Our host, Gail, was ever so warm and welcoming while her husband, Strat, had an incredible wit and delightful sense of humor. We thoroughly enjoyed their company and interesting conversations each morning.
This home had all of the things that one would expect in an Airbnb plus some very thoughtful surprises. It was immaculately clean upon our arrival, had good WiFi and cell service, ample toiletries with Vermont made soaps, a comfortable bed, soft linens and towels. What we did not expect was the decadent towel warmer which was appreciated on chilly mornings, fresh cut flowers from the garden and a delicious breakfast every morning. We have stayed in dozens of Airbnbâ€™s and have never been served a hot breakfast. Gail and Strat alternated the cooking duties using ingredients that were fresh from their own garden, a neighboring farm or the farmers market, a pure delight. Gail had messaged us earlier to identify any dietary restrictions and then went out of her way to provide us with non-dairy milk and cheese.
It is no surprise why they have hundreds of excellent reviews. Their Super host status is very well deserved and our stay with them exceeded our expectations. We will definitely plan to stay here again the next time we visit this area and needless to say have no hesitation recommending Gail & Stratâ€™s lovely home.

Our family (me, my wife, and our two little girls) spent five delightful days in Plainfield with Gail and Strat. Their location is unparalleled for seeing the scenery and tranquillity of the Vermont countryside.
We especially appreciated the accommodations our hosts provided, including the delightful breakfasts. Gail even hung up our laundry on the outdoor drying line for us one day while we were busy enjoying the sights in the Barre/Montpelier area. Both Gail and Strat were attentive each day and offered helpful suggestions - and Strat has the gift of humorous interaction with little kids!
If you're looking for a place which encapsulates what Vermont has to offer at its best - in both landscape and people - I highly recommend this AirBnB.

Stayed about a week
review_text: Gail and Strat's guest space is Vermont country comfort at it's best. Quiet, cool even on hot days (for us), and located close to Plainfield with its wonderful food co-op and other resources. Gail made us delicious home-cooked breakfasts with ingredients from her garden and is knowledgeable about all things local. Her personal library (located in the guest quarters) was particularly enjoyable, covering everything from poetry and classic literature to late-60's civil rights. After a week, we felt steeped in the slow pace of Vermont's green hills, small towns and dirt roads. Don't miss the Creemies! We'll be back.

review_text:
2174 Upper Rd, Plainfield is a great location. It is quiet, the view is beautiful and
Gail and Strat are extremely thoughtful and interesting hosts. We never had conversations like those we had there in any other BnB weâ€™ve stayed at. And the breakfasts that we kibitzed over were darn good too. I have to mention that when Strat filled in for Gail, he did a most commendable job in this department, including making some delicious pancakes.
The bedroom and living room were spacious, comfortable and quite homey. There were a spate of interesting books on the shelves, including some really helpful guidebooks with a number of walks and hikes in Plainfield and the surrounding area.
This is a excellent part of Vermont if you like great walks, interesting towns and fun motoring (Thereâ€™s not many places that I like to drive in, but this is one of the finest ones). Positive Pie just down the road in Plainfield has excellent pizza and salads. Nearby Cabot is a fine little town, but, alas, the Cabot Cheese factory was closed due to the Corona Virus. If you are lucky, it will reopen and you can stop to taste their cheeses.
Also, try and make it over to nearby Bragg Farm Sugar House on Rt. 14 for a super Maple Softee Ice Cream cone.
All-in-all, a fine place to have your quintessential Vermont vacation

review_text:
Gail and her husband are very welcoming and prepare an absolutely delicious breakfast, which they share with guests in the main quarters to their home.
The guest suite is very well kept, clean and includes a full-sized bed, futon that pulls out into a bed, a baby crib, and a sitting table next to large windows overlooking picturesque views. There is no television, but very good wifi which worked perfectly as I caught part of a game on my tablet. The bathroom includes standard sink and toilet, and a very modern walk-in shower with choice of overhead or hand held spray.
The suite attaches to the main portion of the home through a double door, and even though it is in close proximity to their main living quarters, Gail and her husband maintain a perfect balance of friendliness and respect for their guestsâ€™ privacy.
The home is located a few minutes from the charming town of Plainfield, in a rural area high upon a hill with tremendous views. If possible it is best to arrive during sunlight so you can enjoy the beautiful scenery, but also for ease of navigation - you will be away from the brightness of city lights in this wonderful, natural setting!

review_text: When we arrived at the house the pictures were deceiving of the driveway etc. We spent the first two nights with a musty smell and my wife started to have some issues. We contacted the host about it and he said he would refund a night stay. We opened windows and went in the basement where there was water in the basement and smelt really musty. There was a dehumidifier in the basement that was full and the moisture in the air said 80%. we emptied the dehumidifier 3 times and lowered the humidity. I told the host this. The host then on a message to me and said there wasn't an issue with the house but with my "WIFE". The host also went on and said that he found that the water was from a leak from the TUB. Claimed that the house had no issues and said it was my wife. REALLY!!! However, there was a leak in the tub according to the HOST. If you stay here check it out and if any issues get him there to fix it ASAP. DO NOT take his word on anything.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our family was in town for a family reunion, and stayed at James's place. The house was exactly as described, and suited our needs perfectly. There was plenty of bedding and towels, and everything we used was functional (lights, oven/stove, toaster, keurig coffee maker, washer/drier, dishwasher, shower, TV, etc.). That is sometimes not the case in an airbnb, so it was much appreciated. The kitchen has all the cookware and utensils you could want, and all of it is in excellent condition. Very nice plates, bowls, mugs, glasses, flatware, and knives. The "extras" like measuring cups/spoons, vegetable peeler, bottle opener were also available. Plenty of space for 4 people, as well as a few dinner guests. Beds were super comfortable, as were the chairs and sofa in the living room.
This airbnb is not really in walking distance to any attractions or stores. But it's an easy drive almost anything you'd want to do in the Barre/Montpelier area--very close to I-89, a little over a mile to a good grocery store, about 3 miles from town and some good restaurants, and a couple miles to the granite quarries, Thunder Road race track, and the Millstone hiking/biking/x-country ski area.
James communicates very well, and check in/out was super easy. Highly recommend this house!

Stayed one night
review_text: We had never been to Vermont and weren't familiar with cities or neighborhoods but we were doing a short driving tour that included a tour of the Rock of Ages quarry in Barre. James's place was bigger than we needed but reasonably priced and the location made sense. It is, as seen in the pix, on a hill with a view and a deck and meadow. The exuberantly kitschy interior might be confusing for some but underneath the cheerful devil-may-care interior decor (vintage and otherwise) is a solid professional attention to creature comforts for guests. Barbecue implements are set outside with the grill for your use; the kitchen is stocked: coffee, a few eggs in the fridge (in case you've arrived late with no groceries in this rural-ish area that might be hard to explore in the dark), dishes, cookware and implements (in case you've come w/ groceries ready to hibernate); extra blankets, etc. The location is great for the fun, informative quarry tour and various shops and services aren't far.

We were on the tail-end of a New England road trip, and Jamesâ€™ place gave us extra comforts that our other accommodations didnâ€™t.
We were especially grateful for the a/c. Though northern VT is often known for its coolness, it was near 100 with very high humidity while we were there.
We also appreciated the living room space. When a place is advertised for 6 people, itâ€™s nice when the living room provides enough comfortable seating for 6 peopleâ€¦which Jamesâ€™ house did.
Having extra pillows for each bedroom was also a plus. Pillows were sparse or non-existent in other rentals.
James definitely took care of us. He labeled things well and kept things clean. He was flexible and great at communication. The area is quiet, with a spacious yard and beautiful view.

review_text:
James really went above and beyond for myself and my sister. When we hit crisis mode with both the death of a family member and the confirmation that my father has dementia. My sister and I were looking for a place that offered solace and a place to come cry and decompress more after staying with the sadness.
The home itself is so fun and funky. Getting there I had to Video Chat close friends and family from home to show them how great this loving collection of cool funk was displayed. The combo of the collection of kitch to really beautiful period pieces - neat 60s furniture was great. Some I wish I had home they were so comfortable. The bedroom I stayed in had a HUGE closet and the bed was so comfortable I was asleep before you know it. The kitchen pictures do not show the absolute beautiful collection of colored glassware and all the amazing appliances. Check in / out was a dream. Our host James helped me by walking me through the internet process. I wasn't connecting correctly to the internet and he was available and responsive (almost immediately - even after normal hours - as I didn't get back until later) to help which was important since I had to get work done.
When we travel back to Vermont I would stay with James and his homes anytime. I really recommend.
And a special thank you again for our lovely host being super helpful. You made a really horrid time in our lives easier by opening your home for us to stay.

review_text: Excellent place to stay overall. As advertised and communicated. Louise is on top of things. This was our second stay there; the first was two years ago. There is good reason we came back. (We visit relatives in Barre and have stayed multiple places. This is the best place we stayed.) Clean, spacious, thoughtful touches beyond the usual drill of milk and eggs in the fridge: toothbrushes provided, shelves filled with board games and a mixture of good literature, washer and dryer available in the basement, etc. Also a nice yard in the back that we enjoyed last time but did not have time to enjoy as much this time. Though we did see a mama bear with cubs in the woods behind the yard! (Location is on a hill overlooking town, and a short trip to shops and restaurants, but still near the woods.) For folks not on the cutting edge: The "smart" a/c-heat is a challenge to control. Neither the unit itself nor the remote is intuitive. But overall a five-star stay and host.

review_text: I was very disappointed with my stay, unfortunately. Iâ€™ve stayed at a number of Airbnbâ€™s and have never had such a terrible experience. First, we arrived to a 47 degree house because the heat had not been turned on prior to our arrival. The front step was quite icy and there was no salt to put down to melt it. The host had said there was a delivery of salt coming and gave me permission to open the package. The two packages of salt were probably around 50 pounds each, which I had to drag into the house. We found ourselves boiling at night because the heat vents are located at the head of each bed, making it feel like a sauna even with the heat set down to 65. On the first morning, we discovered the coffee maker was dirty, with coffee grounds in the water well. Come to find out it was because the coffee maker doesnâ€™t drip properly and made the water overflow at the filter. The entire trip was just one thing after another. I would not recommend to anyone.

I would highly recommend this place. Itâ€™s centrally located. Itâ€™s right in the middle of town, can walk anywhere. However, itâ€™s also secluded and offers great privacy. While we were there, the town had fireworks (October) and the next day the street was closed off for a festival. Getting food is easy, dining is all local.
The house is located on an inclined street, the back yard is surrounded by a forest. Thereâ€™s a washer and dryer in the basement. The house was very clean and has some great foods to wake up to. We had our dog and the price for for this rental was perfect.
Louise stocked the closets with towels and extra bed coverings. She also had extra fans, a baby gate, and mattresses.
Louise was a fantastic host. She was able to help me out with something, quick to respond, and quick to help out. What a great host!

name: Karin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This is a fantastic rental and very reasonably-priced! We were two adults, a 10-year-old, and a dog and it was perfect for us. Really nice neighborhood for walking around in with the dog - there's a great trail system in one direction and a pleasant safe quiet neighborhood with a wide variety of houses for looking at. Town is close too but if you are walking just note it's a large hill from town to the house :) There was a lovely little back porch that looked into the yard - it's not a big yard but there was plenty of wildlife. We saw a good variety of birds and a fox, raccoon, and skunk!
The house was absolutely spotless and the kitchen very well-stocked with good-quality kitchenware. The couches were ridiculously comfortable and the shower was perfect. There was a great selection of books to read and games to play. Barre is a very central location for Vermont - we were there to visit friends in Shelburne and Montpelier, but we had time for some great bike rides and adventures in Barre itself. Just be aware that Barre is a very hilly town - you'll get your heart rate up for sure! (oh, and fun tip - there is a great skate park in town with nice hiking trails and a dog park in the same area). We would definitely stay again in a heartbeat!

The house is modern, extremely clean, and everything works perfectly. Beds are comfortable, kitchen is stocked great for cooking meals, and the space is very comfortable. In addition, the host has gone above and beyond to provide a great stay. There are so many little details that make this place great. The knives are sharp, there is every cooking utensil you could need, there are books and games and puzzles, soap and toothbrushes in case you forgot to pack something, she has provided chargers everywhere for devices, WiFi is fast and phone service is good. The smart TV is even set to guest mode so that you can sign into your Netflix, Hulu, etc accounts and it will auto sign you out when you leave. Every need you have has been anticipated and provided for. We really felt relaxed and at home and will definitely return. Donâ€™t think twice about booking.

Perfectly secluded scenic getaway but close enough to shopping.

The place is immaculate and the right size for us although it could comfortably also accommodate another couple. Lots of towels and good amounts of blankets and linens. All necessities you'd find in your own home were available. We didn't need for anything. We watched Prime Video series at night on the TV.
We got a chance to meet the cows and pigs. Mike is a very generous and welcoming host.
Would definitely visit again.
Thank you for hosting a beautiful memory

My daughter and I stayed at Michael's place when I needed to attend a weekend-long training in Barre, VT. We couldn't have been more pleased and impressed with our stay! Before even arriving, Michael was easy to communicate with, very responsive and easy going. Upon arrival, I was already exhausted from a long day -and was so pleasantly surprised by how close Michael's place was to the towns of Barre, VT and/ or Montpelier, VT-but also tucked away and well-hidden in a quiet, serene setting. Check-in was beyond easy; the apartment was SUPER clean. We really love things clean and tidy, and Michael's did not disappoint. The floors, the bathrooms, the bedrooms - everything was great. The shower had amazing water pressure, again super welcoming after a long, tiring day. Again, it was QUIET and we slept great both nights we stayed at Michael's....
You will not be disappointed with this space, would highly recommend and will definitely try to stay here again if my work ever takes me this way!

More importantly it was the first trip for our 5-month old daughter and this was a perfect way for us to share our love of animals with her. Michael was an extremely welcoming host, very friendly and outgoing to make sure we felt comfortable and had everything we need. The unit was as clean as you could hope for given the understanding that it's right above an active barn. The sounds and smells that some other reviews have mentioned were so minimal and in fact only added to the charm. We will definitely be recommending this place to our friends and family and will be coming back when our daughter gets a little older and can interact with the animals more. We cannot thank Michael and his family enough for making this a wonderful trip that we will remember for a lifetime!

The fully equipped kitchen was wonderful and we loved the self-serve farm store downstairs where we bought sausage and fresh eggs for our breakfast. Kids got to spend time with the farm animals, â€˜helpingâ€™ with the piglets and petting the hens, ducks, sheep and runty bull calf. They also enjoyed sledding, but we didnâ€™t manage to get out for snowshoeing which you can do right out the door. It was interesting having the pigs temporarily housed in the barn adjacent/below our apartment as temperatures dropped unseasonally to -13 the night we arrived - they are rambunctious haha. Best part of our stay was Michael, generous with his time and friendly welcoming personality. This farm is a gem just five minutes from Montpellier and 45 minutes from Burlington. Do not miss out on this unique farmstay!

name: SalomÃ© And Patryk
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Wicked Bines Farm is a trip into a world of peacefulness, mindfulness and animals. You just canâ€™t go wrong there.
Michael has stocked the house with just about everything (including the kitchen sink, obviously) - the bath towels are super comfy and soft, the kitchen is large and has pots, pans and every utensil you might need, and the bed is clean, comfy and plush with blankets and pillows to spare.
Down under your apartment is a self-serve store with fresh eggs and all the meat you may want, freshly packed and frozen. Just leave anything in the fridge overnight and enjoy farm fresh bacon or sausage in the morning :)
Michael was also super friendly and personable, taking us for a ride on his 4x4 ranger to see the cows and let us feed the pigs and help collect and clean the chicken eggs. Hearing the ducks, pigs squeal, and the roosters in the morning was amazing, and overall our trip was both entertaining and educational, an experience we wonâ€™t forget and will definitely be back again to re-live next year when itâ€™s warmer :)
The one thing I would say to watch out for is that you need to IGNORE GOOGLE if it tells you to drive through Vine to get to Wicked Bines Farm. We tried following Google our first night there and ended up stuck in a muddy field. Even then, Michael was super gracious, and he and his cousin came and saved us and our car. So 10000 points to the farm, Michael, his cousin, and a newfound appreciation for farming life :)
